column4: Ok, I am in the gparted resize screen, resizing an existing windows partition cannot remove any data, right?
I dont have the luxury of backing it up, jrib
I simply cleared 30gb of space
So what does the resizer actually do?
what do you mean what does it do?... it resizes the partitions on the drive.
Yes IndyGunFreak, but what happens to the data on the partition I resize?
It is an NTFS partition
it will all be on the original partition, and the "new" partition will be blank.
*usually* it goes w/o a hitch, but if you have important data, its silly to do it w/o a backup
Well I moved all my important data to a flash drive, only lots of games left
So absolutely expendible
ok,... how big is your current drive?
the drive in question is already parted in two NFTS partitions by windows, each being 89gb
ok.. and what are you wanting to do... shrink the second 89gig partition, for Linux?
Exactly IndyGunFreak, is this sensible?
thats what i would do...
i just can't stress to you enough, make sure anything i mportant is backed up
The resizer is kind of confusing to me, how do I do it?
are you on the live CD now?
Yes IndyGunFreak, on the pidgin that comes with it
ok.. tyupe this w/o quotes.. "/join #indygunfreak"
